Article Title: EC starts examining complaints against PM Modi's speech
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Amidst a growing chorus of opposition condemnation, the Election Commission has initiated an examination of complaints lodged against a speech delivered by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Rajasthan. In the contentious address, PM Modi suggested that if the Congress were to assume power, it would purportedly redistribute wealth to Muslims .The Congress party and the Communist Party of India - Marxist ( CPI-M ) lodged separate appeals with the election watchdog, urging action against PM Modi's remarks made during a rally in Rajasthan.During his speech on Sunday, PM Modi inferred that a Congress-led government would prioritize the allocation of resources to the Muslim community, citing former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's statement regarding the minority community's entitlement to the nation's assets.Sources said the Election Commission has started examining complaints against the speech made by the prime minister.The Congress party, in its plea to the Election Commission, denounced PM Modi's comments as "divisive," "malicious," and targeting a specific religious group. They specifically referenced the remarks made by PM Modi in Banswara, Rajasthan.Similarly, Sitaram Yechury, general secretary of the CPI-M, took to social media to urge the Election Commission to address the complaint promptly. Yechury demanded that proceedings be initiated against PM Modi and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), further advocating for the filing of an FIR."Urge the ECI to take cognisance of this latest complaint and immediately launch proceedings against Narendra Modi and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). An FIR needs to be lodged for inciting communal passions and hatred," Yechury said in his statement.Echoing the sentiments of the opposition, Congress leader and senior advocate Abhishek Singhvi underscored the gravity of the situation, characterizing it as a litmus test for the Election Commission. Singhvi warned that the inaction of the poll panel could blemish its reputation and represent a departure from its constitutional obligation, leaving a legacy of ineffectuality.
Article Summary: PM Modi suggested that if the Congress were to assume power, it would purportedly redistribute wealth to Muslims. The Congress party and the Communist Party of India - Marxist ( CPI-M ) lodged separate appeals with the election watchdog, urging action against PM Modi's remarks.

Article Title: 'My lowest turnout is higher than your highest,' EAM Jaishankar slams Western media
Article Text: NEW DELHI: External affairs minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday slammed Western media , highlighting their tendency to criticise India's democracy , suggesting that they do so because they perceive themselves as political actors in our elections and not because they lack information.Speaking at a forum for nationalist thinkers in Hyderabad, EAM Jaishankar said, "I get a lot of these noises from the Western press and if they criticise our democracy, it's not because they lack information.It is because they think they are also political players in our election."Jaishankar also mentioned that a Western media article questioned India's decision to hold elections during a severe heatwave."Now I read that article and I wanted to say listen, in that heat my lowest turnout is higher than your highest turnout in the best run," EAM said.He added that such actions represent games being played with us."These are politics. These are our domestic politics which is going global, global politics which feels they must now intrude in India. How can these chaps decide who should be ruling them without consulting us?" he said.Moreover, Jaishankar emphasised that the West perceives themselves as constituents of India's electorate, saying, "I think it's time today that we disabuse them and the best way that we do that, is by confidence."The external affairs minister stressed the importance of standing up to such attacks, criticisms, rankings, and reports, noting that they have the potential to question everything."They will question your election system, your EVM, your election commission, even the weather," he said."One complaint is... BJP is so unfair, BJP thinks it's going to win very big," he said, further adding that, in a way, today marks a crucial inflection point.Jaishankar said that the decisions the government will be making are not merely for the next five years but will also provide a significant vote of confidence for our nation, society, and future generations."It is the guarantee, the guarantee is an expression of confidence. It is an expression of confidence based on what we have delivered for the last ten years," EAM added.He emphasised how India has been regarded globally over the past decade and stressed that the country is now gearing up for the next 25 years. This mindset, he argued, should inform our approach to the world.Moreover, recalling the G20 Summit, Jaishankar noted that during India's presidency, several countries expressed a desire to engage with India."During our G20 presidency, a number of countries, but particularly this was an initiative called IMEC through Saudi Arabia, they wanted to connect India to Europe. Russia and Iran also want a connectivity passage to Europe. In the east, countries like Vietnam, and Cambodia, want a passage through Myanmar to India," he said.Lauding India's increasing prominence on the global stage, Jaishankar remarked that there is considerable interest in engaging with India, connecting to India, and collaborating with India. Praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Jaishankar added, "It is the combination of all of this and, as I said, the stature which the prime minister personally commands...I see that because I travel with him often."Recalling India's assumption of the G20 presidency, Jaishankar said, "When we took on the G20 chairmanship on December 1, 2022, many around the world expressed skepticism, questioning how we would manage it and foreseeing challenges. However, during the G20 summit, within the first day, we were able to forge a consensus."He further emphasised that when events unfold, people often only witness the final outcome without recognizing the extensive work that takes place behind the scenes."It's worth thinking why? Because when something happens, we think it's natural. It's not natural. Something happens behind the scenes, you are only seeing the final production, but behind the scenes there is a lot of work," he said.The fact is, during the G20 summit, there was considerable respect for Prime Minister Modi and India as a whole(With inputs from agencies)
Article Summary: External affairs minister S Jaishankar slammed Western media for criticising India's democracy. He said they do so because they perceive themselves as political actors in our elections and not because they lack information. He added that such actions represent games being played with us."These are politics. These are our domestic politics which is going global," he said.

Article Title: MC cracks whip on illegal constructions; takes action against 12 illegal buildings and a colony
Article Text: Ludhiana: Taking stern action against illegal buildings, Municipal Corporation (MC) took action against 12 illegal buildings and a colony being constructed in different areas of MC Zone D on Monday.Of these, eight illegal buildings were demolished including two under construction illegal shops at Jassian road, one commercial building on Jassian road, illegal portions (houseline coverage) of three residential buildings in Lakshmi Nagar, an illegal commercial building near New Krishna Mandir and illegal portion of a building near Khalsa College in Civil Lines.An illegal under construction colony on Jassian road and an encroachment on road portion in Tagore Nagar were also demolished.Further, the civic body teams also sealed four illegal buildings including two shops in Basant Vihar, Jawaddi, one commercial building near Khalsa College for Women in Civil lines and one commercial building in residential area near Krishna Mandir.Building branch officials of MC Zone D said that the drive against illegal constructions was organised on the directions of MC Commissioner Sandeep Rishi. The owners have also been restrained from getting involved in the illegal activities otherwise strict legal action will be taken against them. More such drives will be organised in the coming time.Further the property owners have been appealed to start the construction works only after getting the building plans approved from the civic body, otherwise strict action will be taken against the illegal constructions.
Article Summary: Mumbai Municipal Corporation (MC) took action against 12 illegal buildings and a colony being constructed in different areas of MC Zone D on Monday. Of these, eight illegal buildings were demolished including two under construction illegal shops at Jassian road, one commercial building and an encroachment on road portion in Tagore Nagar.

Article Title: Hemant Soren seeks Supreme Court intervention on Jharkhand high court verdict delay
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Former Jharkhand chief minister Hemant Soren on Wednesday moved Supreme Court, complaining that Jharkhand high court was not pronouncing its verdict on his plea challenging arrest by ED in a money laundering case , despite it being reserved two months back.Mentioning the case before a bench of Justices Sanjiv Khanna and Dipankar Datta as the Chief Justice was heading a constitution bench, advocate Kapil Sibal submitted that HC not pronouncing its verdict one way or other is blocking his way to approach SC and in such scenario he would not be able to come out of custody and election would be over.The bench assured that the court would consider his plea. Soren was arrested on Jan 31 in the case after he resigned as the CM. He was arrested after being grilled by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for hours.
Article Summary: Former Jharkhand chief minister Hemant Soren moved Supreme Court. Soren was arrested on Jan 31 in the case after he resigned as the CM. He was arrested after being grilled by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for hours. The bench assured that the court would consider his plea.

Article Title: PM Modi rattled by Congress revolutionary manifesto: Rahul Gandhi
Article Text:
Congress Drags Modi to EC For 'Infiltrators' Remarks, Blasts 'Wealth To Muslims' Comment

NEW DELHI: Stating that PM Narendra Modi is "shaken, panicked and worried" by Congress 's "revolutionary" manifesto, Rahul Gandhi Wednesday said the first decision of the future party govt will be caste census , which is a must to establish the meagre participation of 90% population of SC/ST/OBCs in the country's public and private structure. He said an X-ray of society - a national headcount to determine the socio-economic status of marginalised sections - is "now my life's mission".The Gandhi scion accused Modi of duplicity, saying the PM told the country in 2014 that he was an OBC but when the issue of "caste census" came up, the PM started claiming there were no castes in India, except "rich" and "poor".Warning that "the entire BJP movement's mission is to erase the history" of 90% population, he said the SC/ST/OBCs are being invisibilised from the country's past including the freedom struggle, and their real history has to be planted afresh."I am not interested in caste, but am interested in 'nyay'. In India, 90% are facing terrible injustice and I didn't even say that we will take any action. I just said let's find out how much injustice is happening. What is objectionable about it?" Rahul asked, adding, "but look at the media and Modi. As I used the word X-ray, everyone started saying this is an attempt to divide the country. How will an X-ray divide? All patriots should like this."The speech at "samajik nyay sammelan" organised by Samruddha Bharat Foundation upped the party's stakes in its recently crafted muscular social justice policy. Rahul posited "caste census" at the heart of the Congress agenda and, in the same breath, suggested that the party's tilt towards SC/ST/OBCs is behind the fresh BJP hostility towards Congress. While he did not touch upon the PM's claims linking Congress to "redistribution of wealth", his "I have not even suggested any action but ..." remark appeared a bid to pit social justice against PM's communal pitch in the ongoing Lok Sabha battle.Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge echoed Rahul by alleging that "BJP poses the biggest danger to SC/ST/OBC/women/minorities" with its "threat to end reservation".Continuing the arguments he has proffered in recent times, Rahul said the mass media has negligible participation of SC/ST/OBCs, which results in anything good for the latter being dubbed as "non serious or divisive". He said the media used to call him "non serious" which rendered the causes he espoused- Land Acquisition Act, Niyamgiri protests, Bhatta Parsaul, NREGA - "non serious", while "Amitabh Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai and Virat Kohli became serious". He said barely 100 judges out of 650 in the high courts are from 90% population, and most do not manage to reach the apex judiciary, while 200 biggest corporations are neither owned by SC/ST/OBC nor have them in the top management.
Article Summary: Gandhi scion says an X-ray of society - a national headcount to determine socio- economic status of marginalised sections - is "now my life's mission" Gandhi scion accused Modi of duplicity, saying the PM told the country in 2014 that he was an OBC but when the issue of "caste census" came up, the PM started claiming there were no castes in India, except "rich" and "poor"

Article Title: Cong tries to control damage, says Pitroda's view not party's
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Congress dissociated itself from chairman of Indian Overseas Congress Sam Pitroda 's comments on inheritance tax and said his remarks were being sensationalised by the media to create a controversy. The party made it clear that it had no plan whatsoever to introduce inheritance tax and reminded that former PM Rajiv Gandhi had abolished estate duty in 1985.Party general secretary in-charge of communications Jairam Ramesh said "it is the Modi sarkar that has wanted to do so".To drive home the point, he said then minister of state for finance Jayant Sinha had publicly stated in 2014 that he wanted to introduce inheritance tax. He shared a video of Sinha speaking on the issue, as also a screenshot of a 2014 post on X by BJP's IT department head Amit Malviya in which he supported Sinha's idea to tax inheritance."In 2018, then finance minister Arun Jaitley praised inheritance taxes for 'spurring large endowments to hospitals and universities in the West'. News reports had emerged that Modi sarkar would introduce an inheritance tax in the Union budget 2019. Over to you PM Modi - what is your party's stance on this issue?" Ramesh asked.With his remarks triggering a row, Pitroda said on X, "It is unfortunate that what I said as an individual on inheritance tax in the US is twisted by 'godi media' to divert attention from what lies the PM is spreading about Congress manifesto. Who said something like this should be done in India? Why is BJP and media in panic?"Reiterating that Pitroda's comments were his own views and not of the Congress, Ramesh said, "Sensationalising Pitroda's comments now and tearing them out of context are deliberate and desperate attempts at diverting attention away from Narenda Modi's malicious and mischievous election campaign; that is anchored in lies and more lies."In another post, Ramesh said the word "redistribution" did not appear in Congress's 'Nyay Patra' but has, however, appeared before in BJP's election manifestos for the Lok Sabha elections in 1999 and 1996.
Article Summary: Congress dissociated itself from chairman of Indian Overseas Congress Sam Pitroda's comments on inheritance tax. The party made it clear that it had no plan whatsoever to introduce inheritance tax and reminded that former PM Rajiv Gandhi had abolished estate duty in 1985.

Article Title: Playing it again: What Sam Pitroda said & status of inheritance tax in India, abroad
Article Text:
What did Pitroda say?

Why the controversy?

What is inheritance tax?

Tackling inequality...

What is the global scene?

Did India have inheritance tax?

Indian Overseas Congress chairman Sam Pitroda’s comments on inheritance tax triggered a political slugfest on Wednesday with PM Modi attacking Congress for planning to impose higher taxes and not wanting people to pass on their hard-earned income to their heirs. Congress distanced itself from Pitroda’s remarks, and party spokesman Jairam Ramesh said former PM Rajiv Gandhi had, in fact, abolished estate duty in 1985.Here’s what the hullabaloo’s all about:He backed the idea of an inheritance tax and cited the example of the US. "Nothing wrong in accumulating wealth but to what point? Let me tell you, in America there's an inheritance tax. So, if let's say one has $100 million worth of wealth, and when he dies he can transfer probably 45% to his children, 55% is grabbed by govt. Now that's an interesting law. It says you, in your generation made wealth, and you are leaving now, you must leave your wealth for the public - not all of it, half of it, which to me sounds fair. In India you don't have that. If somebody is worth $10 billion and dies his children get $10 billion. The public gets nothing. So these are the kinds of issues that people will have to debate and discuss."Pitroda's comments on inheritance tax come against the backdrop of the Congress manifesto talking about addressing "growing inequality of wealth and income through suitable changes in policies" and Rahul Gandhi's speeches pushing for economic and institutional surveys, along with caste census. BJP has cited Rahul's speeches to claim that the surveys would be a prelude to "redistribution" of wealth.This is a tax which is levied on property inherited when a person dies. According to Tax Foundation, a think tank on taxation , estate and inheritance taxes are broadly similar because both are generally triggered by death. Estate taxes are levied on the net value of property owned by a deceased person on the date of death. In contrast, inheritance taxes are levied on the recipients of the property, according to the foundation's definition.Inheritance tax has in some cases been justified to ensure "equality of opportunity". An OECD paper says that by breaking down the concentration of wealth and correcting for factors that are beyond the recipients' control, inheritance and gift taxation can contribute to levelling the playing field across individuals, and thereby increase equality of opportunity and improve social mobility. It cites Thomas Piketty, Saez and Zucman, who have argued that from a meritocratic perspective, inherited wealth should be taxed at higher rates than earned income and self-made wealth. There is an argument against the tax and critics in the US say scrapping it would help raise investments, create jobs and help in expansion of the economy.Several advanced countries, including the US, UK, Japan, France, and Finland, have inheritance tax ranging from 7% to 55%. Since 2000, 11 countries and two tax jurisdictions have scrapped estate or inheritance tax, according to Tax Foundation data. US prez Joe Biden has backed increasing the inheritance tax rate to 61%.India did have an inheritance tax, and levied a peak rate of 85% estate duty, which was abolished in 1985. Death of a property owner triggered the liability on estate duty. According to tax consulting firm Taxmann, 'property' was defined in the broadest possible terms and included all movable and immovable assets, interest in expectancy, interest in co-parcenary property (joint heirship), debt or enforceable right, etc. "The liability on estate duty was cast on the recipient of the estate who was to file a return of estate received based on which the competent authority would complete an assessment. In case an asset was inherited jointly, a joint return was required to be filed," according to Taxmann.Several measures to bring social equity have been imposed in the country, including gift tax, wealth tax and estate duty. Wealth tax was scrapped in 2015, while gift tax was withdrawn in 1998 but reintroduced in 2004, levying income tax on gifts to relatives. There was speculation in 2020 that the Union Budget may bring back estate duty. In 2014, the then junior finance minister Jayant Sinha had backed the idea of bringing inheritance tax but it did not move beyond the idea stage.
Article Summary: PM Modi attacks Congress for not wanting people to pass on their hard-earned income to their heirs. Congress distanced itself from Pitroda’s remarks, and party spokesman Jairam Ramesh said former PM Rajiv Gandhi had abolished estate duty in 1985.

Article Title: Cong's plan to 'impose' inheritance tax aimed at hitting middle and aspirational classes: FM
Article Text: NEW DELHI: In an all-out attack on Congress over Sam Pitroda 's inheritance tax remarks, BJP and its NDA allies said this had exposed the opposition party's "nefarious design" of taking away common people's wealth and property."Pitroda has elaborated the nefarious design of Congress. We are a saving-based economy. In India, one generation (of a family) earns by doing hard work.The second generation builds on that and then the third generation gets some comfort," BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said at a press conference.Trivedi said Congress wanted to snatch away that happiness and peace from people. "By doing an X-ray of the Congress's manifesto, their high tech guru Sam Pitroda has made it clear that both the lives and wealth of people of the country are in danger," he added.Trivedi also alleged that Congress's manifesto was influenced by foreign forces. "Understand how big the danger is. The Communist party, a prominent constituent of INDI Alliance, says it will dismantle India's nuclear weapons and Congress says it will take away from you the little dhan and anna (wealth and food) that you have at home," he said.Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said Congress's plan to "impose" inheritance tax was aimed at hitting the middle and aspirational classes as they would not be able to pass on their savings to their children. "If Congress comes to office, organised loot and legalised plunder will be seen in action," she said on X.I&B minister Anurag Thakur, while participating in a roadshow in favour of BJP candidate Madhavi Lata in Hyderabad, said, "The evil eye of Congress has fallen on public property. These people want to continue their tax collection even after your death," he said, adding that there was a direct threat to property, children, borders and Sanatan Dharma from Congress.Former PM H D Deve Gowda of the JD(S) said Congress wanted to turn the country upside down as they wanted power at any cost. "By speaking of wealth redistribution , Rahul Gandhi has insulted and humiliated two former PMs who brought market reforms and increased the wealth of the nation," the former PM said as he mentioned reforms initiated by P V Narasimha Rao and Manmohan Singh.Coming down heavily on Pitroda over his advocacy of inheritance tax, Rashtriya Lok Dal's Malook Nagar said, "Is he in a sound state of mind? I don't know. It's hard to understand what he tries to say these days. Beyond this, I don't wish to make any further comment."
Article Summary: BJP and its NDA allies said this had exposed the opposition party's "nefarious design" of taking away common people's wealth and property. Former PM H D Deve Gowda of the JD(S) said Congress wanted to turn the country upside down.

Article Title: PM slams Pitroda's remark, says Cong has dangerous intentions, will snatch not only quotas but also wealth
Article Text:
Congress Drags Modi to EC For 'Infiltrators' Remarks, Blasts 'Wealth To Muslims' Comment

Did Former PM Manmohan Singh Say Muslims Have ‘First Right’ To Wealth As PM Modi Claimed? | Watch

RAIPUR: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday grabbed Nehru-Gandhi family confidant Sam Pitroda's support for inheritance tax to sharpen his attack on Congress over Rahul Gandhi's "plan" to redistribute wealth and assets, while keeping up the pressure on the opposition party over reservations. Congress will "loot your earnings, zindagi ke saath bhi, zindagi ke baad bhi", he said."Congress eyes not only your reservation, but also your earnings, your houses, shops and farms.The Congress 'shehzada' says they will conduct an X-ray of the property of every house and every family in the country. Congress will snatch all these things from you to distribute them," Modi said, stopping just short of suggesting that Muslims would be the beneficiaries of the wealth transfer. "I need not tell you whom they will distribute it to," he said as the audience burst into loud applause to indicate that they had got the hint.Modi alleged that Congress had "dangerous intentions". "Congress wants to confiscate properties and assets from people's children and also plans to introduce reservations based on religion," he said, asserting that faith-based reservations were aligned with Muslim League's ideology while being violative of the Constitution."Today, I would like to highlight Congress's Muslim League-like mentality before the people of Surguja. When the Constitution was being drafted under the leadership of Babasaheb Ambedkar, it was decided that reservation would not be based on religion. If there is to be reservation, it will be for my tribal and Dalit brothers and sisters... The day their manifesto was released, I said it has the imprint of Muslim League, and I say so today," Modi said."Years ago, Congress tried to implement reservation on the basis of religion in Andhra Pradesh. It planned to implement it across the country. They talked about implementing 15% reservation on the basis of religion and said it will be done after curtailing SC, ST and OBC quota," he added.Accusing Congress of being "vote-hungry", Modi said, "Congress claims it will bring about revolutionary changes once in office, but the public is not going to give them that chance. The dangerous intentions of Congress are becoming increasingly evident. They have handed over the entire Congress party, as if it was their ancestral property, to their children. But they don't want ordinary Indians to pass on their property to their children."Modi stressed that the culture of the country was not consumerist. "Rather, it values accumulation, enhancement and preservation. This ethos has enabled the preservation of nature and the environment. People in India traditionally preserve their assets, intending to pass them down through generations," he said."When I mentioned that urban Naxalites have infiltrated Congress, there was an uproar, and they issued statements against me... But they should not waste time nitpicking my statements. Congress only wants to loot your property... Will the people of the country allow this?" he asked.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi grabbed Nehru-Gandhi family confidant Sam Pitroda's support for inheritance tax to sharpen his attack on Congress over Rahul Gandhi's "plan" to redistribute wealth and assets. He stopped just short of suggesting that Muslims would be the beneficiaries of the wealth transfer.

Article Title: EC extends poll timing in Bihar over heatwave
Article Text: NEW DELHI: In view of the prevailing heat wave, Election Commission on Wednesday extended the polling duration by two hours in parts of four parliamentary seats in Bihar. The new polling hours in the specific polling stations will be from 7am to 6pm, a move aimed at increasing voter turnout.As per a notification, poll timing in Banka, Madhepura, Khagaria and Munger Lok Sabha constituencies was from 7 am to 4 pm.However, after considering a request of the state chief electoral officer to extend polling hours because of prevailing heatwave and after consultations with political parties "to increase voters' participation", EC has decided to change the polling hours in these seats.EC's decision comes after a relatively lower voter turnout in the first phase of polling on April 19, including in four seats of Bihar, compared to 2019. The notification specified that voting at some polling stations in Banka on Friday, Madhepura and Khagaria on May 7 and Munger on May 13 has been extended to 6 pm.
Article Summary: Poll timing in Banka, Madhepura, Khagaria and Munger Lok Sabha constituencies was from 7 am to 4 pm. EC's decision comes after a relatively lower voter turnout in the first phase of polling on April 19, including in four seats of Bihar, compared to 2019.

Article Title: ED attaches Rs 74cr assets of Sanjay Raut associate in Patra Chawl case
Article Text: NEW DELHI: ED on Wednesday said it had attached properties worth Rs 74 crore of Pravin Raut, a close associate of Shiv Sena (Uddhav) Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Raut, in a money laundering case related to the redevelopment of Patra Chawl in Goregaon, Mumbai. Both Pravin Raut and Sanjay Raut were arrested in the case in 2022 and are out on bail. Total attachment in the case has gone up to Rs 117 crore.The latest attached properties consist of several land parcels of Pravin Raut and his close associates in and around Palghar, Dapoli, Raigad and Thane.ED had earlier attached properties worth Rs 11 crore, including a flat in Dadar belonging to Varsha Raut, wife of Sanjay Raut, and several land parcels in Kihmi beach, near Alibaug, allegedly benami assets of Sanjay Raut and his wife.The case pertains to the Guru Ashish Construction Pvt Ltd (GACPL), a company controlled by Pravin Raut, which was awarded the redevelopment of Patra Chawl by MHADA for the rehabilitation of 672 tenants, develop flats for MHADA, and thereafter sell the remaining land area. "However, the directors of GACPL misled MHADA and managed to sell the floor space index (FSI) fraudulently to nine developers, collecting an amount of Rs 902 crore without constructing the rehabilitation portion for the 672 displaced tenants and flats for MHADA," ED said.The agency further claimed that Pravin Raut diverted Rs 95 crore to his personal bank accounts and used the proceeds for acquisition of various land parcels directly in his own name or in the name of his firm Prathmesh Developers. He later gifted some of these properties to his family members and associates. "Such identified proceeds of crime in the form of land parcels acquired from farmers, gifted properties to family members and equivalent properties of siphoned off PoC to Pravin Raut and associates, have been attached amounting to Rs 73.6 crore," the agency said.
Article Summary: Pravin Raut is a close associate of Shiv Sena (Uddhav) Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Raut. Pravin and Sanjay were arrested in the case in 2022 and are out on bail. The latest attached properties consist of several land parcels in and around Palghar, Dapoli and Raigad.

Article Title: Rajouri killing: LeT ultra identified, police announce Rs 10 lakh reward
Article Text: JAMMU: Police have identified a Lashkar-e-Taiba operative as one of the two terrorists who killed a Territorial Army soldier’s brother at his home in Thanamandi in J&K’s Rajouri on Monday night. They announced a reward of Rs 10 lakh for information leading to the arrest of both terrorists."Credible evidence identifies one of the two killers as a foreign terrorist code-named Abu Hamza.He has been involved in many terror activities. The deceased Mohammad Razaq’s brother, TA soldier Mohammad Tahir Choudhary, was the terrorists’ target, but he dodged their bullets,” police said.Police issued posters with Hamza’s photo on Tuesday evening.Sources said Razak (40), appointed in J&K govt’s social welfare department on compassionate grounds after terrorists killed his father 19 years ago in the same village, suffered critical bullet wounds and died while being rushed to a nearby hospital.Police have rounded up 67 suspects for questioning in the case.The attack, reported to be aimed at disrupting the poll in Anantnag-Rajouri Lok Sabha seat on May 7, prompted a joint operation by police and Army to catch the killers. Jammu zone ADGP visited Rajouri to assess security measures.This is the third terrorist attack on civilians in J&K this election season. On April 17, a 35-year-old roadside food vendor from Bihar was shot dead in Anantnag, while a tourist taxi driver from New Delhi suffered bullet wounds in Shopian district on April 8.
Article Summary: Police have identified a Lashkar-e-Taiba operative as one of the two terrorists who killed a Territorial Army soldier’s brother at his home in Rajouri. The attack, reported to be aimed at disrupting the poll in Anantnag-Rajouri Lok Sabha seat on May 7, prompted a joint operation by police and Army.

Article Title: Venture capital fund for Stem-based solutions for climate and health
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Synapses , a venture capital fund dedicated solely to identifying and supporting STEM-based solutions for climate change and health, announced its launch recently. Founded by IIT alumni and veteran investors, Ruchira Shukla and Karthik Chandrasekar, Synapses, a $125 million venture fund, fills a critical gap between STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) ingenuity and commercialisation by backing STEM start-ups to tackle pressing climate and health challenges, a company statement said.Unlike most deeptech funds in India that have a broad cross-sectoral scope, Synapses has a dedicated focus on climate tech and health tech . This allows for deep domain depth and thesis-driven investing. The companies Synapses supports go beyond digitization-based business models, building STEM solutions that have a strong value proposition in global markets beyond India. This also creates the opportunity for global collaboration and technology transfers, it added.Ruchira Shukla, co-founder and managing partner of Synapses said, “Climate change and an increasing disease burden are the defining challenges of our generation. Synapses is built on the belief that science and technology hold the key to solving these challenges at scale, not just for India, but for the world. We are nurturing a new generation of audacious, path-breaking innovators and helping them build leading global technology businesses to deliver outsized financial returns.”
Article Summary: Synapses is a venture capital fund dedicated solely to identifying and supporting STEM-based solutions for climate change and health. Founded by IIT alumni and veteran investors, Ruchira Shukla and Karthik Chandrasekar, Synapses fills a critical gap between STEM ingenuity and commercialisation.

Article Title: 'PM Modi will have third term': Amit Shah at Kerala rally
Article Text: ALAPPUZHA: 'India will elect Narendra Modi as their PM for the third term, making the country the world's third-largest economic power,' Union Minister Amit Shah said on Wednesday while addressing a rally here, seeking votes for BJP's candidate Sobha Surendran. He added that only BJP and Narendra Modi can keep this country secure.The senior BJP leader also attacked Congress and the ruling Left in Kerala , alleging both were taking the support of a banned organisation, Popular Front of India (PFI), to win the Lok Sabha polls in the state."Till Narendra Modi government is in power, organisations like the PFI will be banned in India," he said. Shah alleged that while the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), the political wing of PFI, openly proclaimed its support for the Congress-led UDF in Kerala, the LDF was silent on the ban on PFI.Shah also attacked the Congress and the Left, alleging that they both pretend to be fighting each other in Kerala and West Bengal, while in other parts of the country, they are together. "Every vote that you give to Alappuzha candidate Sobha Surendran's lotus will help Narendra Modi become the PM."All the surveys show that the whole of Kerala is willing to move ahead with Modi. Kerala' farmers and fishermen are with Modi. From every nook and corner of Kerala, there is a voice to vote for Modi to protect Kerala's culture and heritage," he said.Speaking about why people in Alappuzha should vote for Surendran, he said, "In this election along voting for Surendran to become an MP, you are ensuring that Modi becomes India's PM for the third term.This election is to make India the third largest economy in the world. This election is to make India number in agriculture, technology and manufacturing".Shah is in Kerala on the last day of public canvassing before the state goes to the polls on April 26. He arrived on a chopper at the helipad at Alappuzha Recreation Ground from where he travelled by road to the Punnapra Carmel Ground -- the venue of the public meeting.
Article Summary: The senior BJP leader also attacked Congress and the ruling Left in Kerala. He said both were taking the support of a banned organisation, Popular Front of India (PFI), to win the Lok Sabha polls in the state. Shah is in Kerala on the last day of public canvassing before the state goes to the polls on April 26.

Article Title: Poll preparation in full swing: Udupi has 177 critical booths
Article Text: SP Dr. Arun K stated that of the 866 booths going for elections , 177 are critical booths , and that all the normal booths have at least one policeman deployed. Dr Arun told reporters on Wednesday that all the individual booths are grouped into 57 sectors, and each sector is monitored by a PSI or ASI. The 57 sector officers are overseen by 14 supervisory officers of the rank of Inspectors.These supervisory officers are, in turn, monitored by four DSPs, one for each assembly constituency.The 177 critical booths include 36 booths located in previously Naxal-affected areas. All the 36 booths are provided with armed guards as per ECI guidelines. In addition, there are six armed police patrol vehicles, each covering six booths. A DSP is deputed to monitor these 36 booths. This is in addition to the webcasting or micro-observer in those booths, the SP said.All Inspectors and officers above them have a separate striking force in order to respond to any law and order situation. Apart from that, four reserve platoons are there to respond to any unforeseen circumstances. In total, three SP rank officers, six DSPs, 15 Inspectors, 1501 policemen of other ranks, and around 500 reserve policemen are deployed as part of the security arrangement.The roll call for all officers and men was completed on Wednesday, and they will be sent to the concerned polling booths from the mustering centers on Thursday. SP Arun said that route marches were conducted in all important towns. Adequate arrangements have been undertaken for the conduct of free and fair elections. In order to attend to other emergencies, 112 staff are not taken for election duties. The public is requested to call 112 in case of emergencies. There is also lien staff deployed in police stations to attend to regular activities, he added.
Article Summary: The 177 critical booths include 36 booths located in previously Naxal-affected areas. All the 36 booths are provided with armed guards as per ECI guidelines. In total, three SP rank officers, six DSPs, 15 Inspectors, 1501 policemen of other ranks, and around 500 reserve policemen are deployed.

Article Title: CBI arrests three including Haryana police inspector for taking bribe
Article Text: YAMUNANAGAR: As the Central Bureau of Investigation ( CBI ) arrested three accused persons including an inspector of Haryana Police posted in Yamunanagar , the district police department has started the process to suspend the police officer.The accused persons were arrested on Tuesday and will be produced in the court of special CBI judge in Chandigarh.Yamunanagar SP Ganga Ram Punia said, “Relevant action is being taken to place inspector Balwant Singh, SHO of cyber crime police station under suspension. Departmental and disciplinary actions have also been initiated.”Accused inspector Balwant Singh, who was posted as station house officer (SHO) of cyber crime police station in Yamunanagar district, was arrested on April 23 by CBI along with two private persons while accepting a bribe of Rs 5 lakh from the complainant in this case.On the complaint of Sukhjit Singh of Manimajra, Chandigarh, the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) of CBI at Chandigarh has registered a case under Section 7 of the Prevention of Corruption Act against inspector Balwant Singh and others.It was alleged that the accused inspector of Haryana Police threatened the complainant and demanded an illegal gratification of Rs 40 lakh from him in lieu of not framing him in a case which was under investigation. The CBI said after negotiations, the accused agreed to accept Rs 5 lakh as bribe, but the complainant lodged a complaint with the ACB, CBI in Chandigarh.In his complaint, Sukhjit Singh said, “I was having a jewellery shop in Chandigarh.Inspector Balwant Singh along with another person came to my shop and enquired about one Vikramjeet Singh, proprietor of a firm of Mohali. I told Inspector Balwant Singh that Vikramjeet is the brother-in-law of his tenant Sumir Uppal alias Saurabh who is known to him and has transactions with Vikramjeet because of Sumir Uppal.”“At this Inspector Balwant Singh informed me that they had detained Vikramjeet and a woman. The woman disclosed (to inspector Balwant) that Vikramjeet had given Rs 40 lakh to me (Sukhjit Singh). At this I requested that the woman was telling a lie. I showed some certain documents to inspector Balwant Singh which clearly indicated that Vikramjeet has to give about Rs 26 lakhs to me”, said Sukhjit.Sukhjit added that inspector Balwant did not pay much attention to documents. Sukhjit alleged that the inspector threatened him that he was the investigating officer in this case and he would get his name involved in the case.“Inspector Balwant told me that only he can give relief to him from the said trouble, however I would have to pay him a bribe amount of Rs 40 lakh,” alleged Sukhjit.The CBI laid a trap and caught two accused (private persons) red-handed while demanding and accepting bribe of Rs 5 lakh at the behest of the accused inspector. Later, inspector Balwant Singh was also caught during further trap proceedings.Sources also reveal that inspector Balwant was brought by CBI to cyber crime police station in Sector 18 of Yamunanagar on Tuesday night, where the team inspected the premises in his presence.Earlier, CBI conducted searches at residential and office premises of all accused persons which led to recovery of incriminating documents, which were seized.
Article Summary: CBI has arrested three accused persons including an inspector of Haryana Police posted in Yamunanagar. The district police department has started the process to suspend the police officer. The accused persons were arrested on Tuesday and will be produced in the court of special CBI judge in Chandigarh. The CBI laid a trap and caught two accused red-handed while demanding and accepting bribe of Rs 5 lakh at the behest of the accused inspector.

Article Title: Kurukshetra University granted two patents in April
Article Text:
Kurukshetra:

Kurukshetra University (KU) has been granted two patents by the Patent Office , Government of India in the month of April.“Carboxymethycellulose Ester Based Drug Delivery System” and “Apoptosis Inducing Composition Compromising Triazolothiazolyl-Triazole Derivative of Benzene” are the two patents granted to KU, said an official of KU. KU has now 22 number of patents granted till date.KU vice chancellor Prof Som Nath congratulated the research group and said, “We have taken a number of measures to boost research at KU in the form of incentives to researches, honouring researches, facilitating patent filing through a patent expert, single window express approval for project filing, established incubation, start up and innovation centres and improving quality of research publications.”Prof Som Nath further said that KU has appointed Prof Ramesh Kumar Mehta, an alumnus of KU, as an honorary Professor of IPR & Technology Transfer. Prof Mehta has played an important role in providing expertise and assistance to the faculty members in filing patents without charging any fee from the University.
Article Summary: Kurukshetra University (KU) has been granted two patents by the Patent Office. KU has now 22 number of patents granted till date. ‘Carboxymethycellulose Ester Based Drug Delivery System’ and ‘Apoptosis Inducing Composition Compromising Triazolothiazolyl-Triazole Derivative of Benzene’ are the two patents granted to KU.

Article Title: 75 trains cancelled, 64 diverted as farmers protest at Shambhu station continues
Article Text: AMBALA: As many as 149 trains were affected on Wednesday due to ongoing farmers’ protest on the eighth consecutive day at Shambhu railway station on the Ambala-Ludhiana rail line , said an official of the Ambala division of Northern Railways .As per Deepak Kumar, chief public relation officer of Ambala Division, 75 trains were cancelled, 64 were diverted to other routes, and 10 were either short terminated or short originated.Due to this protest demanding release of three farm activists arrested by Haryana police, in the last 8 days, about 1139 trains including mail express, Shatabdi, passenger, have been cancelled or diverted. The impact of the Ambala-Ludhiana railway line blockade has started to come to Ambala’s cloth market also, as traders are struggling to transport their goods which they did through trains at cheaper fare, as compared to other modes of transport.Shambhu railway station is on a key rail line as through this line Delhi is connected to Punjab and Jammu and Kashmir, but the train traffic has remained affected in the last eight days.The farmers remained seated on the railway lines and kept raising anti-BJP and anti-government slogans. Farmer leader Sarvan Singh Pandher who addressed the farmers protesting at Shambhu said, “Our morchas at Shambhu, Khanauri and Dabwali borders have entered 71 days. Our forums will hold large gatherings at these morchas on completion of 100 days of our protest.”“The gatherings of farmers from all over the country on the 100th day of our morchas will be such that the roots of the Modi government will be shaken. Yesterday, BJP leaders ran away from answering our questions. Today, the Modi government after giving the slogan of Viksit Bharat, is running away from the agenda of development”, said Pandher.Pandher called out the government to immediately order girdawari to give compensation to farmers, who suffered loss of crop due to rain and hailstorm.
Article Summary: 149 trains were affected on Wednesday due to ongoing farmers’ protest on the eighth consecutive day at Shambhu railway station on the Ambala-Ludhiana rail line. 75 trains were cancelled, 64 were diverted to other routes, and 10 were either short terminated or short originated. In the last 8 days, 1139 trains including mail express, Shatabdi, passenger, have been cancelled or diverted.

Article Title: From 'hua toh hua' to 'US inheritance tax': Sam Pitroda 'embarrasses' Congress, again
Article Text:
On Ram Mandir

On 1984 anti-Sikh riots

On Pulwama attack

Nehru vs Ambedkar on Constitution

On Nyay scheme

NEW DELHI: Sam Pitroda has done it again. The chairman of the Indian Overseas Congress has yet again made a remark that has triggered a political storm and put the grand old party on the defensive. Pitroda's remarks on the concept of inheritance tax in the US have been lapped up by the BJP to reinforce its wealth distribution attack on the Congress.It comes at a time when the Congress has been trying hard to counter Prime Minister Modi's relentless attack over its manifesto pitch on socio-economic and caste survey and redistribution of resources.PM Modi on Wednesday seized on Pitroda's remarks to step up a blistering attack on the issue of "wealth redistribution", saying "zindagi ke saath bhi, zindagi ke baad bhi" is the opposition party's mantra to "loot" people.In his poll rallies, PM Modi framed Pitroda's comments in his wider onslaught against the Congress, asserting that they have exposed its hidden agenda and that the party has become so removed from the country's social and family values that it wants to legally rob people of their assets and lifelong savings they want to bequeath to their children.The Congress was quick to distance itself from Pitroda's remarks. Jairam Ramesh who is also the Congress general secretary (Communications) said, "Sam Pitroda expresses his views on issues that he considers important, very freely. On this particular issue also he is not reflecting the official position of the Congress. But I think what is happening is, that his comments are torn out of context and they are being sensationalized in order to divert attention from the PM's deliberate, mischievous and malicious, poison-ridden campaign."Unfortunately for the Congress, this is not the first time that Sam Pitroda has put the grand old party on the backfoot with his "off the cuff" remarks, especially in the election season. Here's a look at some of the old Pitroda remarks that stoked controversy.In June 2023, when the country was waiting for the grand Ram Mandir opening, Pitroda gave BJP ammunition to attack the Congress as he said that temples were not going to solve India’s problems of unemployment, inflation, education, and health. "No one talks about these things. But everyone talks about Ram, Hanuman, and Mandir. I have said that temples are not going to create jobs," he said.In May 2019, Pitroda "hua to hua" (so what) when he was asked about the 1984 anti-Sikh riots."Ab kya hai '84 ka? Aapne kya kiya 5 saal mein, uski baat kariye. ’84 mein hua to hua. You were voted to create jobs. You were voted to create 200 smart cities. Aapne wo bhi nahi kiya. Aapne kuch nahi kiya isliye aap yahan wahan gup lagate hain'," Pitroda had then said.In February 2019, Pitroda kicked up a storm as he raised questions on Balakot air strikes by the Indian Air Force which were carried out in retaliation to the Pulwama attacks. "I don’t know much about attacks. It happens all the time. The attack happened in Mumbai, also. We could have then reacted and just sent our planes, but that is not the right approach. According to me, that’s not how you deal with the world," Pitroda had said.Citing an article by Sudheendra Kulkarni, a former close aide of BJP veteran LK Advani, Pitorda in a social media post had claimed that India’s first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, contributed more than BR Ambedkar in the framing of the Constitution. Pitroda later deleted the post.Pitroda put the Congress party in a tough spot in April 2019 when he said that the middle class should not be selfish. They should be prepared to shell out more taxes to fund the party’s proposed NYAY, a scheme promising a guaranteed minimum income for every poor household, he had said.
Article Summary: Pitroda's remarks on the concept of inheritance tax in the US have been lapped up by the BJP to reinforce its wealth distribution attack on the Congress. This is not the first time that Sam Pitroda has put the grand old party on the backfoot with his "off the cuff" remarks, especially in the election season.

Article Title: Two political heavyweights, but both first timers in a direct election, engaged in the toughest ever poll battle at Nellore parliament
Article Text: TIRUPTI: The Nellore parliament constituency has become a hot seat with two political heavyweights from the YSRCP and the TDP locked horns in an intense high stakes battle in the 2024 general elections.Interestingly, both Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy (TDP) and Venumbaka Vijayasai Reddy (YSRCP) are first timers on the poll scene, though they played a key role in the state politics for more than two decades.While Vemireddy, who served as a Rajya Sabha MP earlier, has entered direct elections at the age of 68, sitting Rajya Sabha MP Vijayasai Reddy has entered the direct elections scene at the age of 66.As it is a case of honour and self pride for both Vemireddy and Vijayasai to emerge victorious, Nellore parliament is witnessing one of the toughest electoral battles ever in the history of this parliament constituency.Though Vemireddy was supposed to contest from the Nellore parliament on a YSRCP ticket originally, he joined the TDP along with his wife and former TTD board member Vemireddy Prashanti Reddy amidst a series of dramatic events that unfolded in January and February earlier this year.While Vemireddy was subsequently fielded from the Nellore parliament on a TDP ticket, his wife Prashanti Reddy is contesting from the Kovur assembly, which is part of the Nellore parliament constituency.After Vemireddy's exit resulted in a political vaccum for the ruling party in Nellore district, the YSRCP roped in Vijayasai Reddy for firefighting and he definitely was an accidental candidate.Speaking to TOI, Vijayasai Reddy observed that in regional parties, the candidates selection process will be the prerogative of the party president. No-one else will have any say in candidates selection."But not realising this, Vemireddy couple and three other legislators including former finance minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy, Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy and Mekapati Chandrasekhar Reddy deserted the party for obvious political gains. But the people of the state will teach these back-stabbers a befitting lesson in the upcoming elections", Vijayasai Reddy underlined.Reacting sharply to Vijayasai Reddy's remarks, Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy said the autocratic leadership at the YSRCP caused him anguish and extreme heartburn. "Despite pledging outright support to the party at all times without seeking anything from the party, the YSRCP leadership didn't even seek my opinion when the crucial Nellore city assembly nominee was chosen. I exited the YSRCP only to protect my self-respect and not for any other reason as is being alleged by my political opponent."Today, people of Andhra Pradesh are in the grip of the fear and insecurity phobia unleashed by the YSRCP govt. They are eager to vote out the ruling disposition and pledge support to the NDA alliance. It is in the interest of the state and Nellore parliament that the TDP should form the next govt to bring back development to the state", Vemireddy exuded confidence.
Article Summary: Both Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy (TDP) and Venumbaka Vijayasai Reddy are first timers on the poll scene, though they played a key role in the state politics for more than two decades. Nellore parliament witnessing one of the toughest electoral battles ever in the history of this parliament constituency.

NEW DELHI: In the 38th match of IPL 2024, Yuzvendra Chahal made history by becoming the first bowler to claim 200 wickets in the tournament's history. Chahal achieved this milestone in his 153rd appearance, having made his IPL debut in 2013. His landmark wicket came when he dismissed Mohammad Nabi during the match between Rajasthan Royals and Mumbai Indians.Meanwhile, Sandeep Sharma's exceptional performance for Rajasthan Royals further solidified their dominance in the IPL 2024 points table.Sandeep took a five-wicket haul, conceding only 18 runs in his four overs. His victims included key Mumbai Indians batsmen such as Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Tim David, and Gerald Coetzee. (Here's a list of updated Orange Cap list) Despite the loss, Purple Cap holder Jasprit Bumrah maintained his lead with 13 wickets, even though he didn't take any wickets in the match against Rajasthan Royals. Gerald Coetzee of Mumbai Indians also went wicketless in the game.In the Purple Cap race, Bumrah leads with 13 wickets, followed by Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel, both with 13 wickets each. Gerald Coetzee is in fourth place with 12 wickets, while Sam Curran holds fifth place with 11 wickets. The competition among bowlers is intense, promising fans more thrilling encounters as IPL 2024 progresses.As the tournament heats up, bowlers like Bumrah, Chahal, and Coetzee are showcasing their skills, setting the stage for an exciting race for the Purple Cap. With each match presenting new challenges and opportunities, fans can expect more stellar performances and thrilling encounters, making IPL 2024 a captivating spectacle.
